champ.champInfo:
Organizing committee and judges:

  • The main judge of the competition is Bohdan Mandrykin (Lutsk)
  • Deputy chief judge — Ihor Girskyi (Lutsk)
  • Technical support — Ihor Tatarchenko (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Lutsk, Grushevsky Avenue 2B

The competition will be held in Lutsk on April 20, 2024.

Competition program

April 19 (Friday):

  • 10:00-12:00 – arrival of teams. pre-weighing
  • 13:30-16:00 - weighing of participants, mandate committee
  • 16:30-18:30 – judges' seminar
  • 19:00-20:00 - drawing of lots

April 20 (Saturday):

  • 09.00-09.30 – ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09.30-12.30 – qualifying matches in the 'Kumite' section
  • 13.30-15.00 – qualifying matches in the "Kumite" section
  • 15.30-17.00 - the beginning of the final part of the competition
  • 17.00-19.00 – end of competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners

Competition rules.

  • Competitions (individual and team) are held in the "KUMITE" section according to the Olympic system, according to the rules of Kyokushinkai karate approved by the Ministry of Family, Youth and Sports of Ukraine in 2004.
  • Competition judging is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the International Organization (5 judges, flag signaling)
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete will be considered defeated
  • Teams of all versions and federations of Kyokushin karate cities of the Kyiv region are allowed to participate in the competition.Kyiv and other regions of Ukraine, which have received an individual official invitation from the organizers of the competition, and recognize these rules of the competition
  • At this tournament, appeals are not accepted. Video recordings of matches are not viewed. Exception: the main judge of the competition can consider only disputed episodes of vazari, ippon, genten, shikaku. Interruption can take place only with the consent of representatives of both teams
  • Competitions are held separately for male and female participants

ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS FOR PARTICIPATION IN COMPETITIONS.

  • All referees must wear official clothing: black trousers (not jeans), a blue short-sleeved shirt with the UFKKU (NFKKU) logo, a yellow bow tie, a personal whistle
  • A white butterfly is allowed to be worn by referees of international category "A"
  • Each team must have at least 2 judges. Protests from teams whose teams will not have judges will not be accepted

COLORS

  • Dogi Requirements: Dogi jackets must have the kanji emblems "kyokushinkai" or "shin-kyokushinkai" on the left side of the sternum. Emblems on the jacket sleeves are allowed (state flag, WKO, UFKK (NFKKU), club emblems, etc.)
  • Dogi pants may contain the kanji emblems "kyokushinkai" or "shin-kyokushinkai", the logo "OSU!", other inscriptions and memorial emblems
  • All other emblems, logos, inscriptions, etc. are prohibited. Therefore, they must be removed from the dog's jacket or pants or covered in advance with a tightly sewn white cloth

Competition participants.

  • All participants must submit the following documents to the mandate committee
    • application letter for participation according to the established form, approved by the medical and physical culture dispensary
    • additional application form according to the established form, approved by the head of the sports organization
    • passport or birth certificate
    • score membership book with parents' visa for permission to participate in competitions for minors
    • a copy of the payment order for the payment of the charity contribution for participation in the competition
    • voluntary insurance policy
  • Participants compete in appropriate uniforms and personal protective protectors in accordance with the Rules of Kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine
  • White shin and groin protectors, girls' chest protector (to be worn under a white T-shirt) are personal and mandatory
  • Helmets will not be provided by competition organizers

Categories of participants:
series A (8 kyu and above)
series B (0 - 9 kyu)

Kumite series A and series B separately:

2012-2013 Boys/Girls -30 -35 -40 -45 -50 -55 +55 Qualifiers: 1 min., 1 min. Semifinal/Final: 1 min., 1 min., 1 min.

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine

Financing

Expenses for organizing competitions (awarding winners and prize-winners, renting sports equipment buildings and auxiliary premises, competition headquarters and office equipment, rent of tatami mats, payment stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing posters and others paraphernalia for competitions, preparation of competition venues, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses on the organization of competitions) are carried out at the expense of the department of culture, youth and sports Gostomel settlement council

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the respective degrees, medals and cups

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until April 14, 2024. or by e-mail:
(hidden)
Ihor Tatarchenko tel. +38(067)-788-77-28

Application letter for participation in the established form, other necessary documents and insurance poles are submitted to the mandate commission during the medical commission and weighing of the participants. Teams that have confirmed their participation within the set deadline are admitted to the competition
